Package com.atakmap.android.maps

Class Wedge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.FilterMetaDataHolder
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapItem
        • com.atakmap.android.maps.Shape
          • com.atakmap.android.maps.Polyline
            • com.atakmap.android.maps.Wedge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIContent, HashtagContent, Capturable, MetaDataHolder, MetaDataHolder2, VisibilityListener
    public class Wedge
extends Polyline
    A wedge describes a triangle (drawn below) with vertex points (X, Y, Y'). There is an offset triangle (labeled "off") below, that allows you to skip an angleX (labeled "x") before drawing your desired wedge with angle "angleXprime" (labeled x' in the diagram below).

    Y' /| label0 / | / | / | / |Y label2 / /| / / | /x'/ | / /x off| X ---------- Z

    label1

    Upper-case letters are points, (e.g., X, Y, Z, Y'). In code, we denote them as "pointX" or "pointYprime". Lower-case letters are angles, (e.g., x, x', y, y') In code, we denote them as "angleX" or "angleXprime". when labeling

    • Method Detail

      • setSourcePoint

        public Wedge setSourcePoint​(GeoPoint pointX)
        Sets the originating point for the wedge.
        Parameters:
        pointX - A valid GeoPoint denoting the start of the Wedge.
        Returns:
        - A new immutable Wedge instance with the source point set. If pointX is null, a default Wedge instance is returned.

      • setEndPoint

        public Wedge setEndPoint​(GeoPoint pointZ)
        Sets the end point for the wedge. See class documentation for how the Wedge is computed.
        Parameters:
        pointZ - A valid GeoPoint denoting the end of the Wedge.
        Returns:
        - A new immutable Wedge instance with its end point set. If poinZ is null, a default Wedge instance is returned.

      • setDistanceMultiplier

        public Wedge setDistanceMultiplier​(java.lang.Double multiplier)
        The multiplier to place the wedge past the z point. Defaults to a value of 1.0. So the wedge would be the exact same distance as Point X to Point Z.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - A double representing the distance multiplier
        Returns:
        - A new immutable Wedge instance with the multiplier value.

      • setOffsetAngle

        public Wedge setOffsetAngle​(java.lang.Double angleX)
        Sets the offset angle for this Wedge. Setting this angle will rotate the Wedge by the supplied value when drawing to screen.
        Parameters:
        angleX - The desired offset angle expressed in degrees
        Returns:
        A new immutable Wedge instance with the offset angle set.

      • setAngle

        public Wedge setAngle​(java.lang.Double angleXprime)
        Sets the primary interior angle for the Wedge.
        Parameters:
        angleXprime - The desired primary interior angle expressed in degrees. The sum of all interior angles must be less than 180 degrees.
        Returns:
        A new immutable Wedge instance with the primary angle set. If the angleXPrime angle is invalid then a default Wedge instance is returned.

      • setAngle

        public Wedge setAngle​(double angleXprime,
                      boolean showLabel)
        Sets the primary interior angle for the Wedge.
        Parameters:
        angleXprime - The desired primary interior angle expressed in degrees. The sum of all interior angles must be less than 180 degrees.
        showLabel - Indicate whether or not the Wedge should have a Label indicating the primary interior angle.
        Returns:
        A new immutable Wedge instance with the primary angle set. If the angleXPrime angle is invalid then a default Wedge instance is returned.

      • setAngle

        public Wedge setAngle​(double angleXprime,
                      java.lang.String label0,
                      java.lang.String label1,
                      java.lang.String label2)
        Sets the primary interior angle for the Wedge.
        Parameters:
        angleXprime - The desired primary interior angle expressed in degrees. The sum of all interior angles must be less than 180 degrees.
        label0 - the label to be displayed for label0 described in the header of this class X->Y' which can be null or empty.
        label1 - the label to be displayed for label1 described in the header of this class X->Z which can be null or empty.
        label2 - the label to be displayed for label2 described in the header of this class Z->Y' which can be null or empty.
        Returns:
        A new immutable Wedge instance with the primary angle set. If the angleXPrime angle is invalid then a default Wedge instance is returned.
